CatDescriptText: Mr. W.C. Robinson, 931-1/2 Clarissa Street, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 12, 1958, pg. A1 with question: �Do you think that the Pittsburgh Railways Company is justified in asking an increase in trolley fares?� answer reads: �No because we are receiving very poor service. I think that the fare is high enough even if we were getting better service.�
TitMainTitle: Portrait of W.C. Robinson, wearing eyeglasses, dark button down collared coat with lapels, light colored herringbone suit jacket, graphic patterned necktie, and dark hat with band, standing in front of light colored concrete wall with stone wainscot, right store window displaying pyjamas
